items.title: Carragher geeft Liverpool dringend advies: 'Een risico dat ze m√≥√©ten nemen'
items.summary: Jamie Carragher heeft Liverpool geadviseerd deze winter opnieuw de knip te trekken. Afgelopen zomer gaf de regerend kampioen al 483,7 miljoen euro uit, maar volgens Carragher is de selectie nog altijd niet in balans.

items.title: Einde van Pep Roulette: Guardiola voert opvallend weinig wijzigingen door
items.summary: De basisopstelling van Manchester City voor de uitwedstrijd tegen Nottingham Forest was voor de zesde keer dit seizoen ongewijzigd ten opzichte van de vorige competitiewedstrijd. Dat is nog nooit voorgekomen sinds de start van Pep Guardiola in Manchester, wat een wijziging in de aanpak van de succescoach lijkt te onderstrepen.

items.title: In-demand Guehi expected to finish season at Palace
items.summary: Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi is expected to see out the final six months of his contract at the club.

items.title: Wat Faber wil zien van Kulenovic na het naderende vertrek van Hornkamp
items.summary: Jizz Hornkamp staat op het punt om Heracles Almelo te verruilen voor AZ. De nummer zeventien van de Eredivisie gaat op zoek naar een vervanger voor Hornkamp, maar hoopt ook dat Luka Kulenovic nog een paar stappen kan maken. 'Er zit nog groei in bij hem.'

items.title: WK-opstelling Oranje volgens de gebroeders Schreuder
items.summary: Voetbal stroomt door de aderen van de broers Alfred, Dick en Bart Schreuder. Hoe zouden de trainers spelen met het Nederlands elftal op het WK van komende zomer? Voor onze camera geven de gebroeders hun ideale opstelling.

items.title: Amorim hails 'spirit' of depleted Man Utd in win
items.summary: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim lauded his team's spirit and togetherness after a depleted squad beat Newcastle on Friday.

items.title: Slot needed to 'convince' Ekitike to reach best form
items.summary: Liverpool striker Hugo Ekitike's five goals in four matches suggest he is starting to get to grips with the Premier League but head coach Arne Slot admits he had to push the player to reach his current levels.

items.title: Wrexham's Moore delighted with brace vs. ex-club
items.summary: Kieffer Moore was pleased to silence the Sheffield United fans after his double inspired a superb Wrexham fightback on Boxing Day.

items.title: Morocco's historic winning streak snapped by Mali
items.summary: Morocco and Mali played to a 1-1 draw on Friday in their second AFCON Group A match, with both sides converting penalties awarded after VAR interventions.

items.title: World Darts Championship LIVE! Gilding, Clayton in action after Ratajski wins thriller
CITY LEAVE IT LATE! Cherki nets at Forest LIVE!
I was there: England‚Äôs Euro 2025 glory was a surreal, almost psychedelic blur
items.summary: Sarina Wiegman‚Äôs champions took supporters on the most thrilling and nail-biting ride in Switzerland that was in many ways even more enjoyable to cover than their 2022 triumph Surreal. Utterly surreal. A home Euros in 2022 had provided wave after wave of emotion, England‚Äôs win at Wembley the culmination of decades of growth, setbacks, fight and deep longing. Everyone sang from the same hymn sheet for that maiden Euros win: the written press, broadcasters, fans, sponsors, Football Association, players and Sarina Wiegman and her staff. There were tears ‚Äì lots. Having begun covering women‚Äôs football for the Guardian via a weekly column before the 2017 Euros, then gone full-time before the 2019 World Cup, I felt as if I had lived that progression, journeyed with them, contributed, in some small way, to that growth. The 2025 edition was different, surreal, an almost psychedelic experience. In many ways better than 2022. This was England‚Äôs first major tournament win ‚Äì male or female ‚Äì away from home. Expectations were high but injuries, retirements and inconsistent performances and results had made most aware that a title defence wouldn‚Äôt be a procession. That made it all the more magnificent. Continue reading...

items.title: How Guardiola made Man City title contenders again - tactical analysis
items.summary: After their Premier League domination came to an abrupt end last season, how has Pep Guardiola changed things tactically to bring about Manchester City's recent revival?

items.title: 'We suffered together' - Amorim changes style as Man Utd win
items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim was rewarded for a change in style and formation with a hard-fought win over Newcastle in the Premier League.
